oai_dc:dc.dc:title: King Chapel at Union Ridge COGIC: front and side view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: King Chapel at Union Ridge Church of God in Christ

Color photograph of church front and side view. Church vestibule and main building are gable-roofed. Vinyl siding covers the building. Entrance steps contain two handrails. Rock foundation of vestibule varies from that of the main building. Double glass doors provide entrance to the vestibule. Light fixtures flank the entranceway and a cross appears above the doors. Three windows are located on the side of the main building. The back portion of the main building contains a four-over-four sash window and a side door. Another section of the building runs perpendicular to the back of the main building. Parking lot is located to the side and front of the church.

The current Kings Chapel building dates from the 1960s. Vinyl siding was added to the frame and additional work was completed in the 1980s. At the time of fieldwork (July 23, 1998), W. L. Rippy served as pastor and the church was thought to have once been the largest in the village.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee;
vestibules; sash windows; steps;
